About Me

I’m a lead cloud native engineer. Normally this means leading a team of engineers with a focus on cloud-technologies, I work both technically as well as interacting with the customer and ensuring we are building a solution that they need. When I’m not doing that I’m working on Pre-Sales, running trainings or working on internal projects to improve openness and satisfaction within the company.

I am most skilled in: Kubernetes & Docker, Python & Technical to non-Technical translation

Projects

NixPkgs

github.com/moredhel/nur-packages

Declarative Operating System

I run nixpkgs on my chromebook (within Crostini), as well as on all my servers/linux laptops. It is a declarative approach to defining package-sets and configuration for a system, whether that be a set of interacting applications or a full-blown operating-system. I have started putting together a set of packages for running within Chromebook’s Crostini environment.

Trow

trow.io

Image Management for Kubernetes Clusters

I was involved in the early alpha-stages of this project. Beginning with setting the base setup for a container registry in Rust.

Building Cloud Native Confidence

I’m a lead cloud native engineer. Normally this means managing a team of engineers with a focus on cloud-technologies. I work technically, and interface continuously with the customer to ensure we are building the solution they need. When I’m not doing that I’m running training in Kubernetes, working on Pre-Sales or carrying out internal projects to improve openness and satisfaction within the company.

FreeLance

Software Engineer

May 2015 - May 2016

During this period I worked on building a JavaScript library to support Fluid Engineers in building an improved UX for running complicated calculations. This was a longer project involving diving into C# to help build an API as well as Fortran to standardise data IO to be machine-readable. The library took considerable planning and engineering time to fully encapsulate the complexities and flexibility required for a generic interface over engineering formulas.

FreeAgent

https://freeagent.com/

Data Engineer & Software Engineer (Intern)

May 2015 - September 2015 & May 2016 - September 2016

During my first experience I was heavily involved in migrating a 500k LOC rails project from rails3 to rails4. As a Data Engineer I was involved in building a machine-learning model, as well as architecting the ML supporting architecture. Additionally I introduced and supported the rollout of Docker within the company. This process involved building and packaging multiple different processes, providing support for Docker-specific issues as well as providing (informal) training to colleagues as I onboarded them.

Education

University of Edinburgh

BSc Computer Science

2013 -2017

Machine Learning & Programming Language Theory

My time in Edinburgh was filled with a number of curricular and extra-curricular activities. Within the University I learned about machine-learning and data-science, building scalable systems and Programming language theory. I attended a number of events focussing on programming language theory and wrote my thesis based on a tool to automatically extract type information from JavaScript.

Additionally I was (and still am) a member of a group of SysAdmins running & maintaining a set of physical servers located on-campus. The project runs a diverse array of different services (GitLab, LDAP, IRC Server, Mail Server as well as any long-running projects that students may want to run in a less regulated/more experimental environment).

During University I also worked within the field as an intern, both over summer and part-time during semesters.
